description: Ms. codex. Title from first text (fol. 2b). Physical description: 13 lines per page. Written in medium large naskh in black ink with use of red. The text is vocalized. Red dots text-stops. Title written in red ink with black vocalization and fillings. Change in paper and script from fol. 50 to fol. 76, and from fol. 87 to fol. 116 (later replacement?, see fol. 76b-77a). Inscriptions on pastedowns and fol. 1a-b. Seriously worm damaged. Extremely fragile.
abstract: Collection of sixteen texts of the Druze community, comprising texts 41-55 in Sylvestre de Sacy's description of Druze writings in Exposé de la religion des Druzes (1838).
contents: 16. fol. 104b-116b: al-Risālah al-mawsūmah bi-al-Taʻaqqub wa-al-iftiqād li-idāʼ mā baqiya ʻalaynā min hadm sharīʻat al-Naṣārá.
title: al-Juzʼ al-awwal min al-sabʻah ajzāʼ ... [etc.].
subject: Druzes—Sacred books
binding note: Acquired from Brill, leyden, 1925, from the books of Murād Bey al-Bārūdī (Beirut).
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
